did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Joseph S. Daltry Papers, 1934 - 1961
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult Special Collections & Archives staff.
did.abstract: Joseph S. Daltry was a music teacher and professor at Wesleyan University from 1918-1967.
Materials from Daltry's career teaching music at Wesleyan, and recordings of Simsbury Light Opera Company Performances from 1948-1950.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Married Faith Merriman, 1926. 3 children: Alice Marshall (b.1927), Mary Augusta Merriman (b.1930), and Faith Barbara (b.1932). Married Marjorie Suzanne Rice, 1959. Died September 27, 1967.

chronitem.event: Daltry was born in Heckmondwick, Yorkshire, England.
Organist, chorus and orchestra director, Wesleyan University
Associate of the Royal College of Organists, London
Associate Professor of Music at Wesleyan University
Received an MA from Wesleyan University. Was a member of Phi Beta Kappa.
Professor of Music at Wesleyan University
Fellow of the American Guild of Organists
President of the New England College Glee Club Association
President of the College Music Association
Director of the Summer School, Wesleyan University

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Materials from Daltry's career teaching music at Wesleyan, and recordings of Simsbury Light Opera Company Performances from 1948-1950.
